attributes.action: bring the monarchy into line with Freedom of Information laws so that correspondence with the royal household, in relation to organisational and financial management of the monarchy, can be made public through FOI requests.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Freedom of Information Act applies to all public bodies, but apparently we have no public body called 'the monarchy'.  As a result this public institution, which spends millions of pounds of taxpayers' money and which represents the country nationally and internationally, is entirely exempt from the Freedom of Information Act.

As British citizens we should have the right to know what public officials are doing in our name, how they are making decisions which affect us and our money.  The royal exemption should be removed and the monarchy should be subject to the same FOI rules as any other public body.

reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
